question: What is Open Source Software?

answers.content: Software in which the source codes are freely used, modify, and shared by anyone are called Open Source Software.
Software in which the source codes are freely used by anyone but cannot be modify and share are called Open Source Software.
Software in which the source codes are used only after be purchased but can be modify and share are called Open Source Software.
Software in which the source codes are used freely after some times and have to purchase later but can be modify and share are called Open Source Software.

question: What is the difference between include(), require()

answers.content: The include() statement includes and evaluates a specified line i.e. it will include a file based in the given path. require() does the same thing expect upon failure it will generate a fatal error and halt the script whereas include() will just gives a warning and allow script to continue.

The require() statement require and evaluates a specified line i.e. it will require a file based in the given path. include() does the same thing expect upon failure it will generate a fatal error and halt the script whereas require() will just gives a warning and allow script to continue.

The include() statement includes and evaluates a specified line i.e. it will include a file based in the given path. require() does the same thing expect upon failure it will not generate a fatal error and not halt the script whereas include() will just gives an alert and disallow script to continue.

The include() statement includes and evaluates a specified line i.e. it will include a file based in the given path. require() does the same thing expect upon failure it will not generate a fatal error and not halt the script whereas include() will just throw an error and allow script to continue.

question: Differences between GET, POST and REQUEST methods ?

answers.content: The information is send via GET method in name/value pair and is URL encoded. The default GET has a limit of 512. The POST method transfers the information via HTTP Headers. The POST method does not have any restriction in data size to be sent. POST is used for sending data securely and ASCII and binary type’s data.

The information is send via GET method in binary code and is Binary encoded.The default GET has a limit of 256. The POST method transfers the information via HTTP Headers. The POST method does not have any restriction in data size to be sent. POST is used for sending data securely and ASCII and binary type’s data.

The information is send via GET method in name/value pair and is URL encoded. The default GET has a limit of 1024. The POST method transfers the information via HTTP Headers. The POST method have any restriction in data size to be sent , the limit is 512. POST is used for sending data securely and ASCII and binary type’s data.

The information is send via GET method in binary code and is Binary encoded.The default GET has a limit of 512. The POST method transfers the information via HTTP Headers. The POST method does not have any restriction in data size to be sent. POST is used for sending data securely and ASCII and binary type’s data.

question: What is session and why do we use it?

answers.content: Session is a super global variable that preserve data across subsequent pages. Session uniquely defines each user with a session ID, so it helps making customized web application where user tracking is needed

Session is a super private variable that preserve data across subsequent pages. Session uniquely defines each user with a user ID, so it helps making customized web application where user tracking is needed

Session is a super global variable that preserve data across subsequent pages. Session uniquely defines each user with a user ID, so it helps making customized web application where user tracking is needed

question: What is cookie and why do we use it?

answers.content: Cookie is a small piece of information stored in client browser. It is a technique used to identify a user using the information stored in their browser (if already visited that website) . Using PHP we can both set and get COOKIE.

Cookie is a large package of information stored in client browser. It is a technique used to identify a user using the information stored in their RAM (if already visited that website) . Using PHP we can both set and get COOKIE.

question: What is the difference between PHP and JavaScript?

answers.content: The difference lies with the execution of the languages. PHP is server side scripting language, which means that it can’t interact directly with the user. Whereas, JavaScript is client side scripting language, that is used to interact directly with the user.

The difference lies with the execution of the languages. JavaScript is server side scripting language, which means that it can’t interact directly with the user. Whereas, PHP is client side scripting language, that is used to interact directly with the user.
PHP & JavaScript are scripting languages that they can interact directly with the user and don't have any differences.
PHP & JavaScript are scripting languages that they can interact directly with the user. However, JavaScript can only directly interact with the user by using a connection gateway.
